camel.source.path.serverUrls.name: camel.source.path.serverUrls
camel.source.path.serverUrls.description: The zookeeper server hosts (multiple servers can be separated by comma)

camel.source.path.path.name: camel.source.path.path
camel.source.path.path.description: The node in the ZooKeeper server (aka znode)

camel.source.endpoint.listChildren.name: camel.source.endpoint.listChildren
camel.source.endpoint.listChildren.description: Whether the children of the node should be listed

camel.source.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeout
camel.source.endpoint.timeout.description: The time interval to wait on connection before timing out.

camel.source.endpoint.backoff.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoff
camel.source.endpoint.backoff.description: The time interval to backoff for after an error before retrying.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.repeat.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeat
camel.source.endpoint.repeat.description: Should changes to the znode be 'watched' and repeatedly processed.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageOn.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageOnDelete
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageOn.description: Upon the delete of a znode, should an empty message be send to the consumer

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.zookeeper.listChildren.name: camel.component.zookeeper.listChildren
camel.component.zookeeper.listChildren.description: Whether the children of the node should be listed

camel.component.zookeeper.timeout.name: camel.component.zookeeper.timeout
camel.component.zookeeper.timeout.description: The time interval to wait on connection before timing out.

camel.component.zookeeper.backoff.name: camel.component.zookeeper.backoff
camel.component.zookeeper.backoff.description: The time interval to backoff for after an error before retrying.

camel.component.zookeeper.bridgeErrorHan.name: camel.component.zookeeper.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.zookeeper.bridgeErrorHan.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.zookeeper.repeat.name: camel.component.zookeeper.repeat
camel.component.zookeeper.repeat.description: Should changes to the znode be 'watched' and repeatedly processed.

camel.component.zookeeper.sendEmptyMessa.name: camel.component.zookeeper.sendEmptyMessageOnDelete
camel.component.zookeeper.sendEmptyMessa.description: Upon the delete of a znode, should an empty message be send to the consumer

camel.component.zookeeper.autowiredEnabl.name: camel.component.zookeeper.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.zookeeper.autowiredEnabl.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
